taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs along the coastal zone and prefers water bodies with little current.  Lives in groups.  Feeds on worms, small insects, crustaceans and plants (Ref. 7020).  The males are generally very much smaller and more svelte than the females.  It is a very prolific species and its reproduction can easily be carried out in the aquarium (Ref. 12225).  With an incubation temperature of 26°C, hatching of the eggs occurs within 48 to 60 hours (Ref. 27188).  Maximum length questionable (Ref. 38376).  Aquarium keeping:  in groups of 5 or more individuals; minimum aquarium size 60 cm (Ref. 51539).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: South America:  Rivers of Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana, and Amazon basin in Brazil and Peru.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Rivers of Guyana, Suriname, French Guiana, and Amazon basin in Peru and Brazil.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Diseases
dataObjects.description: White spot Disease. Parasitic infestations (protozoa, worms, etc.)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: highly commercial

Life stage: unsexed
Note:
Location: Guyana, Essequibo River
